<html><body><div><div class="StoryText_storyText__C3hWI StoryText_storyText__C3hWI"><div><p><span class="dateline">CHAPMANVILLE, W.Va. (WCHS) â€” </span>A man has been charged after allegedly selling drugs to a woman who later overdosed and died in Logan County, troopers said.</p><p>Jimmy Dale Conley Jr., 56, is charged with drug delivery resulting in death and possession with intent to deliver methamphetamine following an incident last week in Chapmanville, according to a news release from West Virginia State Police.</p><p>Troopers said they were initially called to a motel in Chapmanville where a woman was found dead from an apparent drug overdose.</p><p>Through an investigation, troopers said they discovered that Conley allegedly sold the drugs to the woman.</p><p>When Conley was arrested, troopers said they found him in possession of a significant amount of drugs and money.</p><p>Conley is being held on a total of $113,000 bond.</p></div></div></div></body></html>
